name: Power Charts – Responsive Beautiful Charts & Graphs
author: David Gwyer

sections.description:
Power Charts allows you to create highly responsive, flexible charts & graphs for your WordPress site. Choose from an array of configurable chart types.

All charts and graphs are created using the powerful D3.js library.

Click here for plugin support.

If you have a moment, consider leaving feedback in the comments section. This is really important and helps us continuously improve upon the plugin. Help us to make it even better!

Please also rate the plugin if you find it useful.

Thanks for your continued support! ðŸ™‚

David – wpgoplugins.com
sections.installation:
1. Via the WordPress admin go to Plugins => Add New.
  2. Enter ‘Power Charts’ (without quotes) in the text box and click the ‘Search Plugins’ button.
  3. In the list of relevant Plugins click the ‘Install’ link for Power Charts on the right hand side of the page.
  4. Click the ‘Install Now’ button on the popup page.
  5. Click ‘Activate Plugin’ to finish installation.
  6. Under the main Power Charts menu click ‘Add New Chart’.
  7. Select your desired chart type and click ‘Create Chart’.
  8. Use the [pc id=”123″] shortcode in a page, post, or text widget to display a chart. Replace ‘123’ with the specific ID of the chart you want to display.
sections.changelog:
0.1.0, SEPTEMBER 27th – 2017

  • Initial plugin release! This version is a proof of concept release.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Via the WordPress admin go to Plugins => Add New.
  2. Enter ‘Power Charts’ (without quotes) in the text box and click the ‘Search Plugins’ button.
  3. In the list of relevant Plugins click the ‘Install’ link for Power Charts on the right hand side of the page.
  4. Click the ‘Install Now’ button on the popup page.
  5. Click ‘Activate Plugin’ to finish installation.
  6. Under the main Power Charts menu click ‘Add New Chart’.
  7. Select your desired chart type and click ‘Create Chart’.
  8. Use the [pc id=”123″] shortcode in a page, post, or text widget to display a chart. Replace ‘123’ with the specific ID of the chart you want to display.

screenshots.caption: Configure chart settings, and see the chart preview update in real-time!
Add the chart shortcode(s) to any WordPress page, post, or text widget.
View your chart(s) on the front end of your site.
Easily manage your charts via the chart list page.
